intro: Guettarda pohliana, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Guettarda pohliana is also valued for its ability to tolerate various soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
